options: Right to sell stock at set price
Right to buy stock at set price
questions.explanation: A call option gives you the right (not obligation) to buy a stock at a predetermined price.

options: Right to buy stock at set price
Right to sell stock at set price
questions.explanation: A put option gives you the right (not obligation) to sell a stock at a predetermined price.
Strike price is the predetermined price at which the option can be exercised.

questions.text: What does 'in the money' mean for a call option?
questions.explanation: A call option is 'in the money' when the stock price is above the strike price, making it profitable.

questions.text: What is time decay (theta) in options?
questions.explanation: Time decay (theta) is the erosion of an option's value as it approaches its expiration date.

questions.text: What is a covered call strategy?
options: Selling calls on stock you own
questions.explanation: A covered call involves selling call options on stocks you already own to generate income.
Implied volatility reflects the market's expectation of how much the stock price will move in the future.
